revisions.rev:
{{Use mdy dates|date=September 2011}} {{Infobox person | name = Blake Foster | image = | size = 150X | caption = | birthname = Blake Anthony Foster | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1985|5|29}} | birth_place = [[Northridge, California]], U.S. | yearsactive = 1993âpresent | occupation = Actor }} '''Blake Anthony Foster''' (born May 29, 1985) is an American actor and martial artist.
Foster was born in [[Northridge, California]], the son of Patricia and John Foster.
Foster was the ''[[Huggies]]'' baby at the age of sixteen months in 1986. He is perhaps best known for his role as [[Justin Stewart]], the child who assumed the mantle of the Blue Turbo Ranger in the fifth season of [[Power Rangers]], ''[[Power Rangers: Turbo]]'', making his debut for the show in the movie ''[[Turbo: A Power Rangers Movie]]''.<ref>{{cite news|title= TV Playbook: ''Let's Add a Kid!''|work=IGN|url= http://uk.tv.ign.com/articles/935/935812p5.html|accessdate=2010-08-15}}</ref> Foster reprised the role in an episode of ''[[Power Rangers: In Space]]'', wrapping up plot holes left behind from his abrupt departure at the conclusion of ''Turbo''. Foster made appearances at the 2009 [[Anime Expo]]<ref>[http://www.anime-expo.org/archive/ax2009-guests/ax2009-power-ranger-industry-guests/ Power Ranger Industry Guests]</ref> and the 2010 [[Power Morphicon]].<ref>[http://www.officialpowermorphicon.com/guests/ Power Morphicon Guests]</ref> At both events he reunited with his former ''Power Rangers'' co-stars [[Selwyn Ward]], [[Roger Velasco]], [[Patricia Ja Lee]] (Only Anime Expo) and [[Tracy Lynn Cruz]] (Only Power Morphicon).

===Personal life===
Began training in [[Tang Soo Do|American Tang Soo Do]] style [[karate]] under 9th degree black belt Tom Bloom at age 4 and received his black belt on December 15, 1996. He currently holds a 2nd degree black belt in American Tang Soo Do style karate<ref>[http://www.tombloomkarate.com/id6.html Tom Bloom Karate]. URL accessed on June 8, 2009.</ref>
His favorite recording artists are [[Snoop Dogg]], [[Dr. Dre]], [[Tupac]], [[The Rolling Stones]], [[Steely Dan]], [[Michael BublÃ©]], and [[Steeples]].
